summary:
It's magic, baby - 4 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/vFxCtj0pxU

In a universe where The Avengers are all together and everyone is...
caption: It’s magic, baby - 4 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/vFxCtj0pxU In a universe where The Avengers are all together and everyone is still alive, a new old face comes along. She has created an image for herself and trying to explain who she really is, proves to be quite difficult. Especially when her own brother is Tony Stark. Trying to reshape your image is difficult in the public eye.

summary: What People Usually Do During a Movie Intermission:
body:
What People Usually Do During a Movie Intermission:

1. Get Snacks.

2. Use the bathroom.

3. Talk to their friends about the movie so far.

4. Watching that silly cartoon.

5. Spoil key points of the movie to the Internet.

What Marvel Fans Are Going To Do During Avengers: Endgame’s Intermission:

1. Ugly Cry.

2. Pray to Stan Lee.

3. Call Marvel’s number, which you OBVIOUSLY HAVE ON SPEED DIAL to vent out your feelings.

4. Angry Tweet the Russo Brothers, Kevin Feige, and/or Marvel.

5. Spoil key points of the movie to the internet WHILE angry tweeting the Russo Brothers, Kevin Feige, and/or Marvel.

blog.name: frost-iron
blog.title: Frost Iron
blog.description:
Volatile, self-obsessed, doesn't play well with others, and very sexually frustrated.

Welcome to Frost Iron! A blog dedicated to all things Loki/Tony or Tony/Loki if you prefer. If you have any questions or want to submit anything just hit up our ask or submit box. Note: this is a blog for the characters and no RPS(F) will be posted.

Blog owner

summary: The Russos:  how can we further this hero's journey in an emotional way? hmmmmmmmmm……… I KNOW! let's kill the closest people in...
question: The Russos:  how can we further this hero's journey in an emotional way? hmmmmmmmmm……… I KNOW! let's kill the closest people in their lives!!      Give them something happy? Are you Mad!?!?? How will we convey a deep, thrilling story if GOOD things are what motivates our characters???  What do you mean Thor should still want to save the universe if Loki doesn't die horribly in front of him??? Nonsense! Why would he do that??? He needs a heartbreaking reason! It worked for Captain America!

Natasha: *catches arrow without looking up* 
.

body:
Clint, shooting an arrow directly at Natasha’s face: think fast!!

Natasha: *catches arrow without looking up*

.

title: Befriending a Cat
body:
Befriending Tony Stark, the Avengers decide, is rather like befriending a cat.

 Also on AO3

TSB19 - K2 Cat!Tony
Words: 600
Rating: G
Tags: Cat!Tony, Domestic Avengers, 5+1 Things

Befriending Tony Stark, Bruce decides, is rather like befriending a cat.

The man disappears for days at a time – business trips or lab binges – but he always comes wandering back, strolling into Bruce’s lab or the common areas, looking for company and attention.

A bored Tony Stark is dangerous to have around. He starts poking at things.

Mostly it’s harmless, if disruptive; but if tools and/or electronics are involved… best beware of explosions and black-outs.

So Bruce builds up a collection of Tony-friendly projects to distract him with. And if he finds himself actively seeking his lab partner’s company, well…

Befriending Tony Stark, Steve decides, is rather like befriending a cat.

Or, rather, trying to work with the man is like herding a cat. He’ll do what he wants when he wants to, and woe betide anyone who tries to make him do otherwise. Steve likes Tony, but it’s a nightmare working with him.

At his wits end, he finally asks Pepper how she managed so long.

Her answer is simple: Make him think it’s his idea. Stop pushing, and he will cooperate when it matters. Focus on his actions, not his words.

Steve is surprised how smoothly it works.

Befriending Tony Stark, Natasha decides, is rather like befriending a cat.

He is wary and aloof and suspicious… but not above being bribed.

Not in the normal way, with money or favours, but with smaller things. By bringing a cup of coffee or a sandwich whenever she visits the workshop, gradually he comes to welcome her intrusion.

And he returns in kind, leaving little presents outside her room.

A jewelled hair clip that can be pulled apart into lockpicks. Her favourite chocolate-coated cherries. Directions to the bolt-hole of a mark that politics had forced SHIELD to release.

It’s… sweet, really.

Befriending Tony Stark, Clint decides, is rather like befriending a cat.

He’s a great guy to have around, but you never quite know when you’re going to run into one of his boundaries.

One moment they’re happily snarking, and the next his smile turns fake, his words cutting, and he’s making excuses to withdraw. Sometimes Clint can identify the trigger, but often it seems to be nothing, or something that was safe before.

Still, he persists. Learns how to read Tony and when to change the topic. And Tony responds; warning instead of striking, deflecting rather than retreating.

They adapt.

Befriending Tony Stark, Thor decides, is rather like befriending a cat.

While often prickly while awake, a sleepy Tony is shameless at seeking affection.

The common lounge is his favourite target. If you are watching a movie, or reading, or sketching, then at any moment a tired Tony might stumble into the room and curl up, half next to, half on top of you.

Sometimes, you find yourself gently scratching his scalp, or running your fingers through his hair, or stroking his back or arm.

And Tony hums in satisfaction, the sound almost a contented purr.

He is their Tony.

Tony is pissed.

He was already having a bad day, before the villain-of-the-week attacked.

Then, he had been separated from his suit. Then, he had been thrown into the river. Then, he gets back to the fight, and the other Avengers have been immobilised, and the villain is monologuing at them.

Tony snaps. With a scream of rage, he throws himself at the villain, clawing at their face with his nails.

In the end, it takes both Thor and Steve physically lifting him to get him off the cowering villain, fighting all the way.

How dare they attack his friends!

reblog.comment:
Befriending Tony Stark, the Avengers decide, is rather like befriending a cat.

 Also on AO3

blog.title: Just some Filipino guy trying to sort his life out
blog.description: Steven Yeun should be Nightwing. That is all.

title: MCU Power Pack live-action fancast
body:
1) Louis Hynes as Alex Power

2) Millie Bobby Brown as Julie Power 

3) Noah Schnapp as Jack Power

4) Violet McGraw as Katie Power

5) Louis Serkis as Franklin Richards (honorary member of the group and close friend of the Powers)

6) Emily Blunt and John Krasinski as the Invisible Woman and Mr. Fantastic, respectively

7) Christian Bale as James Power (as a break from his typical roles as the main hero, here, he’s the dad of the group)

8) Paget Brewster as Margaret Power 

9) Gwendoline Christie as the voice and mocap of Queen Maraud of the reptilian race, the Zn’rx (the main antagonist)

10) Doug Jones as the voice and mocap of Aelfyre “Whitey” Whitemane of the humanoid horse race, the Kymellians. Appears as the Pack’s main ally against the Zn’rx and is responsible for their powers.  

11) Kenneth Branagh as Douglas Carmody / The Boogeyman, James Powers’ former employer and the secondary antagonist. 

12) Jessica Parker Kennedy as the voice and holographic projection of Friday, the Power Pack ship’s A.I. guide
